title: Android Weekly Issue #656
description: Articles & Tutorials Sponsored Sick of your mobile apps crashing? Simon Grimm will show you how to fix them with less guesswork. Join Sentry's workshop to get practical tools and best practices for debugging Android applications. The Model Mapper: An Essential Component for Your Mobile Applications Nathan Kayumba teaches about Model Mappers, a vital tool to structure your data and simplify its handling. Exploring ViewModel Internals Jaewoong Eum explores ViewModel's inner workings, diving into its internal implementation and understanding how it operates under the hood Sponsored Advertise your Android dev course to over 80k readers We reach out to more than 80k Android developers around the world, every week, through our email newsletter and social media channels. Advertise your Android development course! Migrate your Android Project to Compose Multiplatform Project Abhiraj Khare shows how to migrate an Android application codebase to Compose Multiplatform for iOS, Android and Desktop. Which Local Database Should You Choose in 2025? Tosin Onikute examines the options and shares recommendations to help you choose the best local database for your new project. Using Koin in Compose Multiplatform Ignacio Carrión walks through an example of setting up dependency injection in a Compose Multiplatform app using Koin. Compose Multiplatform: A ready-made Template for your next App David Guerrero makes starting multiplatform apps even easier with a Compose Multiplatform Template. Expandable Text in Jetpack Compose Manpreet Kunnath creates a Show More/Show Less text component in Jetpack Compose. How Google Play Store support progressive app roll out Saud Khan examines how Google Play provides several types of tracks where you are release the app and each of them come with their own limitations and requirements. Libraries & Code ComposableMemes Compose Multiplatform app designed to craft the perfect meme ADBguiKMM A modern Kotlin Multiplatform Desktop client for ADB commands, reimagined from the original Python adbGUI project. Videos & Podcasts How to contribute to open-source software (OSS) Jov Mit's step-by-step guide to contributing to open-source. How to Record the Screen of ANY Android App Philipp Lackner shows how you can record the Android device's screen and save the recording as MP4 in the user's gallery. Guards and Pattern Guards - TypeAlias Show Clip Dave Leeds look at the new pattern guards preview feature in Kotlin 2.1. Type-Safe Deep Link Navigation using Jetpack Compose Daniel Atitienei builds a simple application that opens a deep link to a product screen with a certain ID. Kotlin User Group Mobile Meetup Oct Playlist of presentations from the Cyprus Kotlin User Group meetup in October.

Articles & Tutorials

Sponsored

Sick of your mobile apps crashing?

Simon Grimm will show you how to fix them with less guesswork. Join Sentry's workshop to get practical tools and best practices for debugging Android applications.

The Model Mapper: An Essential Component for Your Mobile Applications

Nathan Kayumba teaches about Model Mappers, a vital tool to structure your data and simplify its handling.

Exploring ViewModel Internals

Jaewoong Eum explores ViewModel's inner workings, diving into its internal implementation and understanding how it operates under the hood

Sponsored

Advertise your Android dev course to over 80k readers

We reach out to more than 80k Android developers around the world, every week, through our email newsletter and social media channels. Advertise your Android development course!

Migrate your Android Project to Compose Multiplatform Project

Abhiraj Khare shows how to migrate an Android application codebase to Compose Multiplatform for iOS, Android and Desktop.

Which Local Database Should You Choose in 2025?

Tosin Onikute examines the options and shares recommendations to help you choose the best local database for your new project.

Using Koin in Compose Multiplatform

Ignacio Carrión walks through an example of setting up dependency injection in a Compose Multiplatform app using Koin.

Compose Multiplatform: A ready-made Template for your next App

David Guerrero makes starting multiplatform apps even easier with a Compose Multiplatform Template.

Expandable Text in Jetpack Compose

Manpreet Kunnath creates a Show More/Show Less text component in Jetpack Compose.

How Google Play Store support progressive app roll out
